required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Prospective Outcomes Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Outcomes Registry of Subjects With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: This registry will collect data on the strategies used to achieve a diagnosis of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) and the treatment and management efforts applied throughout study follow-up, clinical outcome events and patient reported outcome data. Blood samples will be collected periodically throughout the study for use in future research efforts.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Data on natural history of IPF.
primary_outcome.description: Characterize and describe the natural history of patients with a recent confirmed diagnosis of IPF, with emphasis on demographics, co-morbidities, medications, and risks for disease progression or death.

primary_outcome.measure: Data on current practice patterns for diagnosis of IPF.
primary_outcome.description: Understand the current practice patterns for diagnosis of IPF.

primary_outcome.measure: Data on impact of IPF on patient quality of life.
primary_outcome.description: Describe the impact of IPF on patient quality-of-life (QOL).
Collect longitudinal bio-samples for future research on disease presentation, progression, and subject response to clinical interventions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Data on clinical trial participation and management practices.
secondary_outcome.description: Identify factors associated with participation in interventional clinical trials, as part of a patient's care plan.

secondary_outcome.measure: Data on management practices compared to existing guidelines.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare disease-specific management practices with existing guidelines.

secondary_outcome.measure: Data on center-specific practices on outcomes.
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the influence of center-specific practices on patient outcomes.

arm_group.description: Subjects who have been diagnosed with IPF in the 12 months preceding enrollment

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood for DNA collected at enrollment. Plasma and serum samples collected at enrollment and approximate 6-month intervals throughout study follow-up.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects diagnosed with IPF in the 12 months preceding enrollment, identified at one of the enrolling tertiary care centers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ability to read and write in English
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Confirmed diagnosis of IPF by the enrolling facility in last 12 months
- Age > 40 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Malignancy, treated or untreated, other than skin cancer, within the past 5 years.
- Currently listed for lung transplantation at the time of enrollment.

overall_official.affiliation: Duke Clinical Research Institute, Duke University
